channel.title: Comments on: A game of data

item.title: By: jerome
item.dc:creator: jerome
item.description: when I did read the books I planned to do one (or many) visualizations but I wasn't too serious about collecting the data. So, I ended up having to scrape it from fan websites and from the body of the books which I have in text format. The text however is not super-scrape friendly with 22 different characters named Jon and 28 named Will-something, so this has been a fairly manual process. The most interesting dataset is the list of what happens to the characters in the chapters (who appears often, who kills whom...). I also would like to plot the evolution of the loyalty of the characters. When one crucial character flips sides, harm quickly befalls to those who trusted them.
item.content:encoded:
when I did read the books I planned to do one (or many) visualizations but I wasn’t too serious about collecting the data. So, I ended up having to scrape it from fan websites and from the body of the books which I have in text format. The text however is not super-scrape friendly with 22 different characters named Jon and 28 named Will-something, so this has been a fairly manual process.
The most interesting dataset is the list of what happens to the characters in the chapters (who appears often, who kills whom…). I also would like to plot the evolution of the loyalty of the characters. When one crucial character flips sides, harm quickly befalls to those who trusted them.

item.title: By: Jim Vallandingham
item.dc:creator: Jim Vallandingham
item.description:
pretty intense. did you manually collect all this data? I've read through all the books - and to stop and analyze the travels at each chapter would be a serious endeavor!
what other plans do you have for all this data?
item.content:encoded:
pretty intense. did you manually collect all this data? I’ve read through all the books – and to stop and analyze the travels at each chapter would be a serious endeavor!

what other plans do you have for all this data?
